title: Login Issues
body:
Hey guys.
I'm not entirely sure why this is happening.. Last night, I was playing like normal, and all of a sudden the game crashed and kicked me out. Now, every time I go to the log in screen, it says:

Connection Error

Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server
Information Regarding what may have caused this error can be found **here** (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944)
Service availability can be viewed on the League of Legends Server Status web page.

Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what to do. I've tried restarting my computer, shutting it down completely and then restarting it, I've tried logging in LoL as administrator, still nothing. I went to the link provided in the error box, and it did not help at all. My location is in North America, and the page shows NA still working, so..? 
Also, my internet browser is Chrome, I've never used Internet Explorer. A lot of the forums I've found have all been things to do on IE, but I don't use that, and haven't had any problems before last night. 
Any thoughts?



***UPDATE***: The game is now working again in my region. Time was all it took. Thanks for being consistent, Riot!

It sounds like your network is having trouble connecting to the authentication server.  I recommend going over the [connection issues ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)guide to help fix this up.  Let me know your results, or if you're still having issues logging in.
This may sound like a dumb question, but bear with me.. How do I find out my household's ISP?

Your ISP would be your internet service provider.  Depending on your location, it could be a standalone internet provider or maybe even your cable tv company.  There might also be a slight chance that your ISP's logo is on your router!  Hope that helps.

ISP = internet service provider. Ask whoever pays for internet or https://www.whoismyisp.org/ probably works.
You also may not use Chrome but your computer does. Have you tried restarting your modem? Unplug it for 30 seconds then plug it back in (this will knock out internet for whomever is connected to this modem while it restarts - allow up to 5 minutes once plugged back in).
I am not quite the computer/tech expert.. What exactly is a modem? And I do use Chrome, I don't use any other browsers or anything, only Chrome.

You may use Chrome personally, but your computer is using Internet Explorer in the background for programs. Modem is where you ethernet cable (big phone looking cable that provides internet) is most likely plugged into.
